name: Mandarin Oriental, Washington D.C.

reviews.text: The Mandarin never fails to impress. Top notch service and the spacious bathrooms for a Washington DC hotel is great!
reviews.title: Always a great stay
Exquisite as always
reviews.text: Can't ask for much view in DC but facing the marina is excellent!
Great lobby lounge staff!
reviews.title: Nicest staff ever!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Mandarin oriental is always a great choice no matter where you stay. D.c. Is not the exception. Staff is friendly. I personally did not get a beautiful view, but room was clean and bathroom great. D.c is quite expensive, so take extra $. Would stay again.
reviews.title: Excellent service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was in the Maryland/D.C. area for 10 days of work travel. I'm so glad that I was at the Mandarin for the last five day of my trip (I was sick with a cold and exhausted). The friendly service and beautiful accommodations made all the difference. Literally every person I encountered was WONDERFUL (bell staff, restaurant staff, front desk, room service, cleaning lady -- EVERYONE). Not to mention they offered complimentary drinks and snacks in the Tai Pan Club everyday (which definitely came in handy). When you have to travel a lot for work, great hospitality makes life that much easier. Based on this experience I will definitely keep the Mandarin group in mind for other personal and business travel.
reviews.title: Not as great the second time

reviews.text: Just stayed at this beautiful hotel along the Potomac for a few nights for a conference. It is very well located, just down the street from the Smithsonian Metro station and just a little further from the L'Enfant Metro. When there is not a government shutdown, it is a great location for sight seeing. You can see the Jefferson Memorial from the hotel.
reviews.title: Very nice, wonderfully located hotel

reviews.text: The room was very spacious, great view. The service was fantastic. They provide turndown service as well. The room service is very expensive. We spent $45 more for room service breakfast than the restaurant breakfast. Both were delicious however. The spa, water features, pool and fitness room were also great. Concierge service was very helpful, except the hotel car was never available. Price is very high if you do not get a conference rate.
reviews.title: Nice hotel but not 5 star

reviews.text: Overall a five star experience.
reviews.title: Mandarin Oriental, DC - New to US, but Great

reviews.text: The hotel overall is nice. I just spent 3 nights here and the staff was friendly although housekeeping wants to barge in your room at 7:45am every morning with 3 consecutive doorbell rings and then busts in the room. So don't forget to put the "do not disturb" sign on. There is NO movies-on-demand. So if you enjoy watching movies in bed after a long day of touring the city, or working, do NOT pick this place. The spa was great one day, then the next I was a few minutes late to my 2 session spa day and they gave my entire block of treatments away with charging me, so that sucked.
reviews.title: Mandarin Oriental makes sequestration a little less painful

reviews.text: It's a good location but you must have a car or take a taxi everywhere. It's not walking distance to anything.
reviews.title: Expected better from a Mandarin Oriental
prestine
reviews.text: I stayed here for a work trip and wish I had just a bit more time to actually enjoy the room and spa. The hotel is beautiful and clean and modern. The bathroom and tub were especially lovely. The staff were attentive. I could not have been happier!

Was here for a conference and was completely unimpressed given the pedigree (Mandarin Oriental) and room rate ($700+/nt). The location is great....if you want to hike East Potomac Park and mingle with federal workers at L'Enfant Plaza, but otherwise it is very, very isolated. I know Washington quite well and enjoy being able to explore different neighborhoods and try new restaurants, but there is none of that in close proximity to the Mandarin. As for the room itself, it was superb, even though the key didn't work in the minibar. My biggest irritation was after taking a great 2 hour hike along the Potomac I came back to the hotel hoping to have a nice brunch outside before my conference began....except that the restaurant closes between 11 and Noon on Sundays? I was completely shocked and annoyed that I had to have room service on a beautiful Fall day, AND pay the room service charge on top of that! Yep, first world problems, but at these hotel rates you'd expect a bit more.
reviews.title: Not so much

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Everything about the Mandarin Oriental blew us away - the staff, the cleanliness, the spacious rooms, the view, the location, the amazing food.
reviews.title: 5 Stars. Can't wait to go back.

reviews.text: The location is amazing and it's only a short walk to all of the main attractions. We were at the Washington Monument within minutes and the rest of the National Mall is right there.
reviews.title: First Class Act!

reviews.text: The hotel kindly offered to store our bikes in the luggage area without charge so we would not have to call for our car every time we left to go sightseeing which we appreciated greatly. Every single staff member we encountered right down to the housekeepers went out of their way to make sure we were happy and well taken care of. They were always smiling, always accessible and always happy to help.
reviews.title: Expensive and a bit tired

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Basic a carbon copy of San Fran hotel, minimalist furniture, but an expansive bathroom and nice view of the Potomac, Very helpful concierge. A very short ride to the airport, and close to Ebbett's grill.
reviews.title: Consistent minimalist oriental

reviews.text: Super location in DC. You can easily walk the National Mall from the Lincoln Memorial all the way to the Capital Building. The hotel is a little non-descript from the outside but once you get inside it is beautiful and in pristine condition. All the staff I interacted with were incredibly friendly and helpful. I had clean room, comfortable bed with a great view. Definitely would visit again on business or for a personal trip.
reviews.title: Great hotel in a very cool location

reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here in middle October and really enjoyed the hotel. The rooms feel like spas with spacious baths. Their is even a flat screen tv in the bath. The views are ok. Most face the parking lot. Ask for the Jefferson Memorial view
reviews.title: This is a top notch hotel with nice rooms

reviews.text: So nice to receive the Mandarin Oriental style welcome, in the US. No line; warm and cheerful desk staff; quickly finished and escorted to the elevator, all of which is calming after a trip.
reviews.title: Welcomed vs. Checked-in

reviews.text: I forgot my razor and toothbrush, and debated whether I had time to call for them and wait for them to arrive, or if I had to go to the lobby myself, possibly look for a convenience store. It's the Mandarin Oriental, knocking on my door a bare minute after I called... Service!
reviews.title: Deluxe City View

description: Overlooking the Jefferson Memorial, Mandarin Oriental, Washington DC is located in the heart of the nation’s capital at the juncture of the Potomac Tidal Basin and Washington Channel, between Maine and Maryland Avenues and 12th and 14th Streets, SW. This location, with views of both the city and the water, is convenient to the National Mall, Smithsonian Museums, numerous monuments and Capitol Hill. Accessible by Metro Rail from either the L’Enfant Plaza or Smithsonian stops.
